meanings.definition: To bring to an end; finish or complete

examples.english: They concluded the meeting with a vote of thanks.
examples.chinese: 他们以感谢投票结束了会议。

examples.english: The ceremony concluded with a standing ovation.
examples.chinese: 仪式以起立鼓掌结束。

meanings.definition: To reach a decision or form an opinion as a result of reasoning

examples.english: Based on the evidence, the detective concluded that the butler was innocent.
examples.chinese: 根据证据，侦探推断管家是无辜的。

examples.english: After examining all options, we concluded that this was the best course of action.
examples.chinese: 在检查了所有选项后，我们得出结论，这是最佳行动方案。

meanings.definition: To arrange or settle by formal agreement

examples.english: The two nations concluded a peace treaty.
examples.chinese: 两国签订了和平条约。

examples.english: They concluded the deal with a handshake.
examples.chinese: 他们以握手达成了交易。

meanings.definition: Capable of causing an explosion; likely to explode

examples.english: The scientists handled the explosive materials with extreme caution.
examples.chinese: 科学家们极其谨慎地处理爆炸性材料。

examples.english: The mixture becomes explosive when heated.
examples.chinese: 这种混合物加热后会变得易爆。

meanings.definition: Occurring or developing with extreme rapidity or intensity

examples.english: The company has experienced explosive growth in the past year.
examples.chinese: 该公司在过去一年经历了爆发性增长。

examples.english: His explosive temper often got him into trouble.
examples.chinese: 他爆裂的脾气经常让他陷入麻烦。

meanings.definition: A substance or device that can cause an explosion

examples.english: The police found explosives hidden in the abandoned building.
examples.chinese: 警方在废弃建筑中发现了隐藏的爆炸物。

examples.english: Military explosives require special handling and storage.
examples.chinese: 军用炸药需要特殊处理和存储。

meanings.definition: Existing as an essential constituent or characteristic; intrinsic

examples.english: The inherent beauty of the landscape inspired many artists.
examples.chinese: 风景的内在美感启发了许多艺术家。

examples.english: There are inherent risks in any surgical procedure.
examples.chinese: 任何外科手术都有固有的风险。

meanings.definition: Inborn or naturally present rather than acquired or imposed from outside

examples.english: She has an inherent talent for music.
examples.chinese: 她有天生的音乐才能。

examples.english: The inherent qualities of the material make it perfect for this application.
examples.chinese: 这种材料的固有特性使其非常适合这种应用。

meanings.definition: Extending or reaching throughout the world; global
meanings.chineseDefinition: 全球性的；遍及全世界的

examples.english: The company has a world-wide distribution network.
examples.chinese: 该公司拥有全球性的分销网络。

examples.english: The pandemic had world-wide implications.
examples.chinese: 这场大流行病具有全球性影响。

meanings.definition: Throughout the world; globally

examples.english: Their products are sold world-wide.
examples.chinese: 他们的产品在全球销售。

examples.english: The news spread world-wide within hours.
examples.chinese: 这个消息在几小时内传遍全球。

meanings.definition: To feel about with the hands, especially when unable to see

examples.english: She groped for the light switch in the dark room.
examples.chinese: 她在黑暗的房间里摸索着找电灯开关。

examples.english: He groped his way along the wall to find the door.
examples.chinese: 他沿着墙壁摸索着寻找门。

meanings.definition: To search blindly or uncertainly; to attempt to find something by feeling about

examples.english: The team is still groping for a solution to the problem.
examples.chinese: 团队仍在摸索解决问题的方法。

examples.english: Politicians were groping for answers to the economic crisis.
examples.chinese: 政治家们正在摸索应对经济危机的对策。

meanings.definition: To touch or fondle someone for sexual pleasure, especially without their consent

examples.english: She reported being groped on the crowded train.
examples.chinese: 她报告说在拥挤的火车上被人猥亵。

examples.english: The celebrity was accused of groping several fans.
examples.chinese: 这位名人被指控猥亵多名粉丝。

meanings.definition: An act of groping or feeling about

examples.english: After a few gropes in the dark, he found the doorknob.
examples.chinese: 在黑暗中摸索几下后，他找到了门把手。

examples.english: The investigation was just a grope in the dark.
examples.chinese: 这次调查只是一次盲目的摸索。

meanings.definition: A rigid bar resting on a pivot, used to move a heavy or firmly fixed load with one end when pressure is applied to the other

examples.english: He used a lever to pry open the crate.
examples.chinese: 他用撬棍撬开了板条箱。

examples.english: The ancient Egyptians used levers to move heavy stones.
examples.chinese: 古埃及人使用杠杆移动重石。

meanings.definition: A projecting handle used to operate a mechanism

examples.english: The pilot pulled the lever to lower the landing gear.
examples.chinese: 飞行员拉动操纵杆放下了起落架。

examples.english: She pushed the lever to start the machine.
examples.chinese: 她推动控制杆启动了机器。

meanings.definition: A means of exerting influence or achieving an end

examples.english: Economic sanctions are an important lever in international diplomacy.
examples.chinese: 经济制裁是国际外交中的重要手段。

examples.english: The government used tax incentives as a lever to encourage investment.
examples.chinese: 政府利用税收优惠作为鼓励投资的手段。

meanings.definition: To move or lift with a lever

examples.english: They levered the rock out of the ground.
examples.chinese: 他们用杠杆把岩石从地里撬出来。

examples.english: He levered himself up onto the ledge.
examples.chinese: 他撑起身子爬上了岩架。

meanings.definition: Relating to moral principles or the branch of knowledge dealing with these

examples.english: The committee is responsible for ethical oversight of research.
examples.chinese: 该委员会负责研究的伦理监督。

examples.english: They discussed the ethical implications of the new technology.
examples.chinese: 他们讨论了新技术的伦理影响。

meanings.definition: Conforming to accepted standards of conduct
meanings.chineseDefinition: 合乎道德的；符合伦理的

examples.english: The company prides itself on ethical business practices.
examples.chinese: 该公司以合乎道德的商业行为为荣。

examples.english: It was not ethical to use that confidential information.
examples.chinese: 使用那些机密信息是不道德的。

meanings.definition: Denoting products that have been produced without harming animals or the environment
meanings.chineseDefinition: 符合道德标准生产的；道德消费的

examples.english: She only buys ethical clothing from sustainable sources.
examples.chinese: 她只购买来自可持续来源的道德服装。

examples.english: The store specializes in ethical and fair-trade products.
examples.chinese: 这家商店专营道德和公平贸易产品。

meanings.definition: The act or process of improving

examples.english: The company is focused on continuous improvement of its products.
examples.chinese: 公司专注于产品的持续改进。

examples.english: There has been significant improvement in her condition since the surgery.
examples.chinese: 自手术以来，她的状况有了显著改善。

meanings.definition: A thing that makes something better or is better than something else

examples.english: The new software includes several improvements over the previous version.
examples.chinese: 新软件包含了对前一版本的多项改进。

examples.english: The redesigned kitchen is a vast improvement on what was there before.
examples.chinese: 重新设计的厨房比以前的有了很大改善。

meanings.definition: A change or addition that enhances the value or quality of land or property

examples.english: They made several improvements to the house before selling it.
examples.chinese: 他们在出售房子前对其进行了多项改良。

examples.english: The landlord refused to pay for the improvements made by the tenant.
examples.chinese: 房东拒绝为租户所做的改良支付费用。

meanings.definition: Not occupied; empty

examples.english: The apartment has been vacant for months.
examples.chinese: 这套公寓已经空置了几个月。

examples.english: There are several vacant seats in the front row.
examples.chinese: 前排有几个空座位。

meanings.definition: (of a position or office) Not filled by an incumbent

examples.english: The position of director has been vacant since June.
examples.chinese: 主任职位自六月以来一直空缺。

examples.english: There are three vacant positions in the marketing department.
examples.chinese: 市场部有三个空缺职位。

meanings.definition: Having or showing no intelligence or interest; empty-minded

examples.english: He had a vacant expression on his face.
examples.chinese: 他脸上带着茫然的表情。

examples.english: She stared with vacant eyes at the television.
examples.chinese: 她用呆滞的眼神盯着电视。

meanings.definition: A person, especially a child, who stays away from school without permission

examples.english: The school has a program to help truants return to regular attendance.
examples.chinese: 学校有一个帮助旷课者恢复正常出勤的计划。

examples.english: Chronic truants often fall behind in their studies.
examples.chinese: 长期逃学的人通常在学习上落后。

meanings.definition: Absent without permission, especially from school

examples.english: Truant students face disciplinary action.
examples.chinese: 逃学的学生面临纪律处分。

examples.english: The truant officer visits the homes of absent students.
examples.chinese: 负责旷课的官员访问缺席学生的家。

meanings.definition: To stay away from school without permission

examples.english: He truanted from school to go to the beach.
examples.chinese: 他逃学去了海滩。

examples.english: Students who truant regularly often have underlying problems.
examples.chinese: 经常旷课的学生通常有潜在问题。

meanings.definition: An action or event regarded as morally or legally wrong and causing general public outrage

examples.english: The financial scandal led to the resignation of several executives.
examples.chinese: 这起金融丑闻导致几位高管辞职。

examples.english: The politician's career was ruined by the bribery scandal.
examples.chinese: 这位政治家的职业生涯被贿赂丑闻毁了。

meanings.definition: Malicious gossip about the private lives of others

examples.english: The tabloids are full of scandal about celebrities.
examples.chinese: 小报充斥着关于名人的流言蜚语。

examples.english: She loves to spread scandal about her neighbors.
examples.chinese: 她喜欢散布关于邻居的谣言。

meanings.definition: A state of affairs regarded as wrong or reprehensible and causing general public outrage or anger
meanings.chineseDefinition: 令人愤慨的事态；不道德的状况

examples.english: It's a scandal that so many children live in poverty.
examples.chinese: 如此多的儿童生活在贫困中，这是一种令人愤慨的状况。

examples.english: The poor condition of public hospitals is a national scandal.
examples.chinese: 公立医院的恶劣状况是一个全国性的丑闻。

meanings.definition: Existing but not yet developed or manifest; hidden or concealed

examples.english: The child showed latent artistic talent from an early age.
examples.chinese: 这个孩子从小就表现出潜在的艺术天赋。

examples.english: The disease can remain latent for years before symptoms appear.
examples.chinese: 这种疾病可以潜伏多年才出现症状。

meanings.definition: (in psychology) Present but not consciously realized or expressed
meanings.chineseDefinition: 潜意识的；未被意识到的

examples.english: Freud believed that many behaviors are driven by latent desires.
examples.chinese: 弗洛伊德认为许多行为都是由潜在欲望驱动的。

examples.english: The therapist helped her explore her latent feelings of anger.
examples.chinese: 治疗师帮助她探索潜意识中的愤怒情绪。

meanings.definition: (of a fingerprint, virus, etc.) Present but not visible or active

examples.english: The forensic team was able to detect latent fingerprints on the glass.
examples.chinese: 法医小组能够检测到玻璃上的潜在指纹。

examples.english: The herpes virus can remain latent in nerve cells for years.
examples.chinese: 疱疹病毒可以在神经细胞中潜伏多年。

meanings.definition: A person who occupies land or property rented from a landlord

examples.english: The landlord increased the rent for all tenants in the building.
examples.chinese: 房东提高了大楼所有租户的租金。

examples.english: As a tenant, you have certain rights and responsibilities.
examples.chinese: 作为租户，你有一定的权利和责任。

meanings.definition: A person or organization that occupies property or land for a fixed period under an agreement

examples.english: The shopping mall has several commercial tenants.
examples.chinese: 这个购物中心有几个商业租户。

examples.english: The farm tenant pays rent to the landowner annually.
examples.chinese: 农场承租人每年向土地所有者支付租金。

meanings.definition: To occupy as a tenant

examples.english: The building is tenanted by several small businesses.
examples.chinese: 这座建筑由几家小企业租用。

examples.english: They tenanted the farmhouse for over twenty years.
examples.chinese: 他们租住农舍超过二十年。

meanings.definition: Relating to or used in psychiatry

examples.english: She works in a psychiatric hospital.
examples.chinese: 她在一家精神病医院工作。

examples.english: The patient received psychiatric treatment for depression.
examples.chinese: 患者接受了抑郁症的精神科治疗。

meanings.definition: Relating to mental illness or its treatment
meanings.chineseDefinition: 精神疾病的；精神疾病治疗的

examples.english: The new drug is used to treat various psychiatric disorders.
examples.chinese: 这种新药用于治疗各种精神障碍。

examples.english: He has a history of psychiatric problems.
examples.chinese: 他有精神问题的病史。

meanings.definition: An outdoor fire built at a campsite for cooking and warmth

examples.english: The scouts gathered around the campfire to roast marshmallows.
examples.chinese: 童子军围坐在营火旁烤棉花糖。

examples.english: They built a campfire to keep warm during the cold night.
examples.chinese: 他们生了一堆篝火在寒冷的夜晚保暖。

meanings.definition: A social gathering around an outdoor fire, especially at a campsite

examples.english: They told ghost stories during the campfire.
examples.chinese: 他们在篝火晚会上讲鬼故事。

examples.english: The summer camp ended with a traditional campfire and sing-along.
examples.chinese: 夏令营以传统的篝火晚会和大家一起唱歌结束。

meanings.definition: To support or strengthen; to reinforce

examples.english: The government introduced measures to bolster the economy.
examples.chinese: 政府推出措施以支持经济。

examples.english: The new evidence bolstered their case.
examples.chinese: 新证据加强了他们的论点。

meanings.definition: A long, narrow pillow or cushion

examples.english: She propped herself up with a bolster to read in bed.
examples.chinese: 她用一个长枕支撑着自己在床上阅读。

examples.english: The sofa came with matching bolsters for extra comfort.
examples.chinese: 沙发配有配套的长枕，以提供额外的舒适感。

meanings.definition: A structural part designed to eliminate friction or provide support or bearing

examples.english: The engineer added a bolster to strengthen the bridge's structure.
examples.chinese: 工程师添加了一个支承物来加强桥梁结构。

examples.english: The metal bolster provides additional support for the heavy machinery.
examples.chinese: 金属支柱为重型机械提供额外支撑。

meanings.definition: A person who comes to live permanently in a foreign country

examples.english: Many immigrants come to this country seeking better opportunities.
examples.chinese: 许多移民来到这个国家寻求更好的机会。

examples.english: The city has a large community of Italian immigrants.
examples.chinese: 这座城市有一个庞大的意大利移民社区。

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of immigrants

examples.english: The immigrant population has contributed greatly to the country's culture.
examples.chinese: 移民人口对该国文化做出了巨大贡献。

examples.english: Immigrant neighborhoods often preserve traditions from their home countries.
examples.chinese: 移民社区通常保留了来自祖国的传统。

meanings.definition: A particular order in which related events, movements, or things follow each other

examples.english: The coach demonstrated the correct sequence of movements for the exercise.
examples.chinese: 教练演示了这个练习的正确动作顺序。

examples.english: The events must be performed in a specific sequence.
examples.chinese: 这些事件必须按特定顺序执行。

meanings.definition: A set of related events, movements, or items that follow each other in a particular order

examples.english: The film included a dramatic action sequence.
examples.chinese: 这部电影包含了一个戏剧性的动作场景。

examples.english: The dancer performed a complex sequence of steps.
examples.chinese: 舞者表演了一系列复杂的舞步。

meanings.definition: The order in which nucleotides or amino acids are arranged in a DNA, RNA, or protein molecule

examples.english: Scientists analyzed the DNA sequence to identify genetic mutations.
examples.chinese: 科学家分析DNA序列以识别基因突变。

examples.english: The protein's function is determined by its amino acid sequence.
examples.chinese: 蛋白质的功能由其氨基酸序列决定。

meanings.definition: To arrange in a particular order

examples.english: The director sequenced the scenes to create maximum dramatic impact.
examples.chinese: 导演对场景进行排序以创造最大的戏剧效果。

examples.english: The laboratory has equipment to sequence DNA samples.
examples.chinese: 实验室有设备对DNA样本进行测序。

meanings.definition: A biological community of interacting organisms and their physical environment

examples.english: The coral reef is a diverse marine ecosystem.
examples.chinese: 珊瑚礁是一个多样化的海洋生态系统。

examples.english: Pollution can disrupt the balance of an ecosystem.
examples.chinese: 污染可能会破坏生态系统的平衡。

meanings.definition: A complex network or interconnected system
meanings.chineseDefinition: 复杂网络；相互关联的系统

examples.english: Silicon Valley has developed a thriving startup ecosystem.
examples.chinese: 硅谷已经发展出一个繁荣的创业生态系统。

examples.english: The company has built an ecosystem of products and services.
examples.chinese: 该公司已经建立了一个产品和服务的生态系统。

meanings.definition: A matter of interest or importance to someone

examples.english: Environmental protection is a major concern for many voters.
examples.chinese: 环境保护是许多选民关心的主要问题。

examples.english: The safety of the children is our primary concern.
examples.chinese: 孩子们的安全是我们首要关心的事。

meanings.definition: Anxiety; worry

examples.english: She expressed concern about her son's health.
examples.chinese: 她表达了对儿子健康的担忧。

examples.english: There is growing concern over the rising cost of living.
examples.chinese: 人们对生活成本上升的忧虑日益增加。

meanings.definition: A business or company

examples.english: Her father runs a small publishing concern.
examples.chinese: 她父亲经营着一家小型出版公司。

examples.english: The family concern has been in business for generations.
examples.chinese: 这家家族企业已经经营了几代人。

meanings.definition: To relate to; to be about

examples.english: The report concerns the impact of climate change on agriculture.
examples.chinese: 这份报告关于气候变化对农业的影响。

examples.english: This policy only concerns employees who work full-time.
examples.chinese: 这项政策只涉及全职员工。

meanings.definition: To worry, trouble, or make anxious

examples.english: Her strange behavior concerned her parents.
examples.chinese: 她的奇怪行为让她的父母担忧。

examples.english: The lack of progress on the project concerns me greatly.
examples.chinese: 项目进展缓慢让我非常担忧。

meanings.definition: To move or cause to move from one place, person, or situation to another

examples.english: The company transferred him to their London office.
examples.chinese: 公司将他调到了伦敦办事处。

examples.english: The patient was transferred to a specialist hospital.
examples.chinese: 患者被转移到一家专科医院。

meanings.definition: To pass or hand over the possession or control of something to someone else

examples.english: She transferred ownership of the property to her daughter.
examples.chinese: 她将房产的所有权转让给了女儿。

examples.english: The funds will be transferred to your account within three business days.
examples.chinese: 资金将在三个工作日内转入您的账户。

meanings.definition: The act or process of transferring

examples.english: The transfer of power occurred peacefully after the election.
examples.chinese: 选举后权力的移交和平进行。

examples.english: There was a delay in the transfer of funds between banks.
examples.chinese: 银行之间的资金转账出现了延迟。

meanings.definition: A person or thing that has been transferred
meanings.chineseDefinition: 调任者；转学生；转会球员

examples.english: The university accepted twenty transfers from other colleges this semester.
examples.chinese: 这学期大学接收了二十名来自其他学院的转校生。

examples.english: The team's new striker is a transfer from their main rival.
examples.chinese: 球队的新前锋是从主要竞争对手转会来的。

meanings.definition: A ticket allowing a passenger to change from one route or vehicle to another

examples.english: The bus driver gave her a transfer to the downtown line.
examples.chinese: 公交车司机给了她一张到市中心线路的换乘票。

examples.english: Your ticket includes a free transfer to any connecting train.
examples.chinese: 您的票包含免费转乘任何接驳列车。

meanings.definition: Originating in or characteristic of a distant foreign country

examples.english: The restaurant serves exotic dishes from Southeast Asia.
examples.chinese: 这家餐厅提供来自东南亚的异国菜肴。

examples.english: She collects exotic plants from around the world.
examples.chinese: 她收集来自世界各地的外来植物。

meanings.definition: Attractively unusual or strange; excitingly different

examples.english: She has an exotic beauty that turns heads wherever she goes.
examples.chinese: 她有一种异国情调的美，走到哪里都会引人注目。

examples.english: The novel is set in an exotic location.
examples.chinese: 这部小说的背景设在一个奇异的地方。

meanings.definition: An exotic plant or animal
meanings.chineseDefinition: 外来物种；异国植物或动物

examples.english: The botanical garden has a special section for exotics.
examples.chinese: 植物园有一个专门展示外来植物的区域。

examples.english: Some exotics can become invasive when introduced to new environments.
examples.chinese: 一些外来物种在引入新环境时可能会变得具有侵略性。

meanings.definition: To change from a liquid or solid state into vapor

examples.english: The water in the puddle evaporated in the hot sun.
examples.chinese: 水坑里的水在炎热的阳光下蒸发了。

examples.english: Alcohol evaporates more quickly than water.
examples.chinese: 酒精比水蒸发得更快。

meanings.definition: To disappear gradually

examples.english: His enthusiasm for the project evaporated when he realized how much work it would require.
examples.chinese: 当他意识到这个项目需要多少工作时，他的热情消散了。

examples.english: All my fears evaporated when I saw her smile.
examples.chinese: 当我看到她的微笑时，我所有的恐惧都消失了。

meanings.definition: To remove moisture from (something) by heating

examples.english: The process evaporates the milk to create a concentrated product.
examples.chinese: 这个过程使牛奶蒸发以创造浓缩产品。

examples.english: They evaporated the solution to obtain the crystals.
examples.chinese: 他们蒸发溶液以获得晶体。

meanings.definition: The events that will necessarily happen to a particular person or thing in the future

examples.english: She believes that it was her destiny to become a doctor.
examples.chinese: 她相信成为医生是她的命运。

examples.english: No one can escape their destiny.
examples.chinese: 没有人能够逃脱自己的命运。

meanings.definition: The predetermined course of events considered as something beyond human power or control

examples.english: He accepted his illness as destiny.
examples.chinese: 他接受自己的疾病，视为命中注定。

examples.english: Some cultures believe that destiny is written in the stars.
examples.chinese: 一些文化认为命运写在星辰之中。

meanings.definition: The ultimate purpose or intended outcome

examples.english: The nation's destiny is to be a beacon of democracy.
examples.chinese: 这个国家的使命是成为民主的灯塔。

examples.english: She fulfilled her destiny by becoming a world champion.
examples.chinese: 她通过成为世界冠军实现了自己的命运。

meanings.definition: To put or keep out of sight; conceal from view

examples.english: She hid the presents in the closet until Christmas.
examples.chinese: 她把礼物藏在壁橱里直到圣诞节。

examples.english: The thief hid the stolen jewelry under the floorboards.
examples.chinese: 小偷把偷来的珠宝藏在地板下。

meanings.definition: To keep (oneself) out of sight

examples.english: The children hid behind the curtains during the game of hide-and-seek.
examples.chinese: 孩子们在捉迷藏游戏中躲在窗帘后面。

examples.english: The suspect is hiding somewhere in the city.
examples.chinese: 嫌疑人正躲在城市的某个地方。

meanings.definition: To prevent (something) from being known or discovered

examples.english: He tried to hide his disappointment with a smile.
examples.chinese: 他试图用微笑掩盖自己的失望。

examples.english: The company was accused of hiding financial losses from investors.
examples.chinese: 该公司被指控向投资者隐瞒财务亏损。

meanings.definition: The skin of an animal, especially when tanned or dressed

examples.english: The boots were made from buffalo hide.
examples.chinese: 这些靴子是用水牛皮制成的。

examples.english: Leather is produced by tanning animal hides.
examples.chinese: 皮革是通过鞣制动物皮革生产的。

meanings.definition: A place of concealment or refuge

examples.english: The hunters built a hide to observe the wildlife.
examples.chinese: 猎人建造了一个隐蔽处来观察野生动物。

examples.english: The criminal's hide was discovered by police dogs.
examples.chinese: 罪犯的藏身处被警犬发现了。

meanings.definition: Having previously been a particular thing

examples.english: The former president attended the ceremony.
examples.chinese: 前总统出席了仪式。

examples.english: She is a former champion who now coaches young athletes.
examples.chinese: 她是一位现在教练年轻运动员的前冠军。

meanings.definition: The first of two people, things, or groups previously mentioned

examples.english: Given the choice between coffee and tea, I prefer the former.
examples.chinese: 在咖啡和茶之间选择，我更喜欢前者。

examples.english: Of honesty and wealth, the former is more important.
examples.chinese: 在诚实和财富之间，前者更重要。

meanings.definition: A person who previously held a specified position or role

examples.english: The formers of the company gathered for a reunion.
examples.chinese: 公司的前任们聚集在一起举行重聚会。

examples.english: The new CEO consulted with his former for advice.
examples.chinese: 新任首席执行官向他的前任请教建议。

meanings.definition: Very bad or unpleasant; extremely disagreeable

examples.english: The food at that restaurant was awful.
examples.chinese: 那家餐厅的食物很糟糕。

examples.english: We had an awful experience with the customer service.
examples.chinese: 我们有一次可怕的客户服务经历。

meanings.definition: Used to emphasize the extent of something, especially something unpleasant or negative

examples.english: There was an awful lot of noise coming from next door.
examples.chinese: 隔壁传来了非常大的噪音。

examples.english: We had to wait an awful long time for our food.
examples.chinese: 我们不得不等待极长时间才能吃到食物。

meanings.definition: Inspiring awe; formidable or impressive

examples.english: The awful power of the storm was evident in the destruction it left behind.
examples.chinese: 风暴的可怕威力在它留下的破坏中显而易见。

examples.english: The ancient temple had an awful grandeur about it.
examples.chinese: 这座古庙有一种令人敬畏的宏伟。

meanings.definition: Very or extremely (used as an intensifier)

examples.english: I'm awful sorry about the confusion.
examples.chinese: 我对这种混乱感到非常抱歉。

examples.english: She's been awful busy lately with her new job.
examples.chinese: 她最近因为新工作而极其忙碌。

meanings.definition: Painful or aching

examples.english: My muscles were sore after the long hike.
examples.chinese: 长途徒步后我的肌肉很酸痛。

examples.english: I have a sore throat and can't swallow properly.
examples.chinese: 我嗓子疼，不能正常吞咽。

meanings.definition: Feeling anger, resentment, or grief

examples.english: He was still sore about not getting the promotion.
examples.chinese: 他仍然为没有得到晋升而恼怒。

examples.english: They were sore losers who refused to congratulate the winning team.
examples.chinese: 他们是输不起的人，拒绝祝贺获胜的队伍。

meanings.definition: Severe or serious (used as an intensifier)

examples.english: The team was in sore need of new equipment.
examples.chinese: 团队急需新设备。

examples.english: The drought has put farmers in a sore predicament.
examples.chinese: 干旱使农民处于严重的困境。

meanings.definition: An open wound or painful place on the body

examples.english: The patient had pressure sores from being bedridden.
examples.chinese: 病人因长期卧床而有压疮。

examples.english: Cold sores often appear on the lips during illness.
examples.chinese: 唇疱疹通常在生病期间出现在嘴唇上。

meanings.definition: Severely or intensely (archaic)

examples.english: He was sore afraid of what might happen.
examples.chinese: 他非常害怕可能发生的事情。

examples.english: The news hit them sore hard.
examples.chinese: 这个消息对他们打击极大。

meanings.definition: Almost entirely; nearly

examples.english: The project is virtually complete.
examples.chinese: 这个项目实际上已经完成了。

examples.english: The species is virtually extinct in the wild.
examples.chinese: 这个物种在野外几乎灭绝了。

meanings.definition: By means of virtual reality or simulation

examples.english: You can virtually explore the museum from your home.
examples.chinese: 你可以在家中虚拟探索这个博物馆。

examples.english: The architect created a virtually rendered model of the building.
examples.chinese: 建筑师创建了一个虚拟渲染的建筑模型。

meanings.definition: In essence or effect, although not formally or actually

examples.english: She is virtually the leader of the organization, though she holds no official title.
examples.chinese: 虽然她没有官方头衔，但她实际上是组织的领导者。

examples.english: The two companies are virtually the same after the merger.
examples.chinese: 合并后，这两家公司实质上是相同的。

meanings.definition: In a way that can be perceived by touch; palpably

examples.english: The sculpture was tangibly different from its photograph.
examples.chinese: 这座雕塑与其照片有明显可感知的不同。

examples.english: The fabric feels tangibly softer after washing.
examples.chinese: 这种布料洗涤后摸起来明显更柔软。

meanings.definition: In a clear and definite manner; substantially or materially

examples.english: The new policy has tangibly improved working conditions.
examples.chinese: 新政策明显改善了工作条件。

examples.english: Their support was tangibly demonstrated through generous donations.
examples.chinese: 他们的支持通过慷慨的捐赠得到了实质性的体现。
